definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: If they take us alive, they will deliver us to Ramsay.
sentences.chinese: 若被他们生擒，我们会被直接交给拉姆西。

sentences.english: And the king of Ai they took alive, and brought him to Joshua.
sentences.chinese: 生擒了艾城的王，将他解到约书亚那里。

sentences.english: He took Agag king of the Amalekites alive, and all his people he totally destroyed with the sword.
sentences.chinese: 生擒了亚玛力王亚甲，用刀杀尽亚玛力的众民。

sentences.english: After all, a mate is prey to be captured alive.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，伴侣是需要被生擒的猎物。

sentences.english: He knew very well that he would never allow himself to be taken alive.
sentences.chinese: 他很明白，绝对不愿让他们生擒活捉。

sentences.english: Goku may be ghosts and goblins have been eliminated or captured, as early as left the Dragon King's palace.
sentences.chinese: 可能是妖魔鬼怪已被悟空消灭或生擒，早离开了龙宫。

sentences.english: But they took the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.
sentences.chinese: 生擒了艾城的王，将他解到约书亚那里。

sentences.english: They took 3 prisoner in the fight.
sentences.chinese: 格斗中他们生擒了三名囚犯。

definition: to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
to fight with all one's might
to subdue/to force to capitulate/to reduce to submission/to soothe
